Vita cuiusdam sci viri nomine Alex. optima vita.
Sitteþ stille wiþouten strif,
and I schal telle &yogh;ou þe lif
Of an holy man.
Alex was his ry&yogh;te name ;
To serue god þoute him no schame
&yogh; þerof neuere he ne blan.
his fader was a gret lording
Of rome, a kynges euening,
&yogh; hy&yogh;tte sire Eufemian.
Pore men to cloþe &yogh; fede
In al rome, þat riche þede,
Swich ne waster non.
Eche day were in his halle
Leyd þre bordes, forto calle
pore men to fede.
hem to serue he was wel glad
&yogh; dede as Ihu crist him bad;
þerfore he hopede han mede.
When þei were serued by &yogh; by,
þane at arst was he redy
To gon to his mete;
þanne in drede of godes sone
Wiþ men of religione
he wolde sitte &yogh; ete.
his wif hy&yogh;tte dame agles,
To seye þe soþe wiþoute les,
þat meche was to preyse;
Bote &yogh;e my&yogh;tte do þe same maner
þat dede hire lord, as y seyde er,
Was &yogh;e nat wel at ayse.
Child hem bi twene ne hadde þei non;
þer fore to god he maden here mon,
Boþe be day &yogh; ny&yogh;the;
Ihu crist herde here bone
&yogh; sente hem a ful god sone,
here hertes forto ly&yogh;the.
When he was bore, þat blisful child,
Alex, boþe mek &yogh; myld,
and of maneres hende:
A litel after wiþ greth hast
þei avoweden to him chast
To here lyues ende.
þer after was it nat lange:
Alex coude speke &yogh; gange,
and was set to lere.
Sone he was a ful good clerk,
meche he louede godes werk
fforto speke &yogh; here.
Sone whan he gan to belde
&yogh; forto comen to mannes elde,
him was chosen a wif,
Out of þe emperoures bour,
a mayde good, of greth honur,
To wedde wiþoute strif.
Whan þei were wedded þe ferste ny&yogh;th
In godes, as it was ry&yogh;th,
&yogh; was I brouth to house:
Mekliche he gan hire teche,
To drede god, of sinne leche,
þat is maydenes spouse.
he prechede hire wiþ al his my&yogh;th:
Of sinne &yogh;e scholde hauen no ply&yogh;th,
Bote kepe hire maydenhod;
&yogh; of ihu, þat mayde clene,
In whom was neuere wem I sene,
&yogh;e scholde habbe hire mede.
þanne tok he his goldring
&yogh; &yogh;af þat mayde, þat was &yogh;ing,
&yogh; seyde to hire þus:
Tak þis ring &yogh; kep it me,
Til þat godes wille be,
God bi twene vs.
Whanne he hadde ido, as &yogh;ou sey,
he tok his leue &yogh; wente his wey
fro þat mayde fre;
a parti of his good he wiþ him tok,
and al þat oþer he for sok,
he wente to þe see.
he fond schipes redely;
To on he wente priueli,
Ouer forto fare;
he seyde: he was a chapman,
&yogh; preyde: he moste wiþ hem gon,
&yogh;if þat here schip were &yogh;are.
fforþ he wente wiþ godes wille,
a fair cyte he com vn tille;
þe name I schal &yogh;ou telle:
Edissa hatte þat cite;
Godes seruant þer to be,
þer inne wolde he dwelle.
þe goodes þat he wiþ him brougth,
Of hem ne wolde he ry&yogh;th nowth,
bote &yogh;af hem pore menne;
his robe he &yogh;af þer he sey nede,
&yogh; cloþede him sulf in pore wede,
ffor noman scholde him kenne.
he &yogh;ede to a churche &yogh;ate,
þer pouere men sete in þe gate
almesse forto take;
among hom he sat a doun
&yogh; askede wiþ deuocion
Sum good for godes sake.
þat churche was of oure leuedy;
þer inne was a greth selly,
an ymage of hire son,
Maked of a wonder werk,
þat neyþer lewed man ne clerk
Niste hou it was don.
þerfore was þider greth sekyng
Of on &yogh; oþer, old &yogh; &yogh;ing,
Of al þat countre;
ffor þi þe pouere þat þer were
Alle þe betere my&yogh;tte fare
þoru here charite.
Alex of þat he my&yogh;tte gete
Nedliche bote þat him self wolde ete
he ne held to his byhoue;
To pouere men þat wolde it take
al &yogh;e &yogh;af for godes sake,
þat is in heuene aboue.
Nou is alex dwelled þere,
his fader at hom seyet &yogh; sore
&yogh; seyþ allas allas.
his moder wepuþ ny&yogh;th &yogh; day
&yogh; seyþ allas &yogh; weylawey,
þat euere &yogh;he born was.
his wif wepþ &yogh; makeþ hire mone,
&yogh; þus schal lyuen allone,
as turtle opon þe tre,
Euere more wiþoute make ;
Ioye &yogh; blisse &yogh;e wile for sake,
Til &yogh;e hire spouse se.
Nou his fader wiþ dreri chere
he biddeþ his men him comen nere,
Als þei willen hauen þere mede,
&yogh; preyeþ hem þat þei ben boun,
To wende &yogh; sechen his dere sone
In euerich ilk a þede.
"þat &yogh;e ne dwelle for no þing,
Ar &yogh;e hauen herd sum tyding,
Where þat he be;
Goþ nou swyþe, &yogh; god &yogh;ou spede!
þerfore I schal, so god me rede,
&yogh;iuen &yogh;ou gold &yogh; fee."
Nou gon þei forþ alex sekynd
In diuerse londes to here tyding,
&yogh;if þei him my&yogh;tte wynne;
Somme of hem þoru godes grace
Comen into þat ilke place
þer alex was Inne.
he sat in pore mene rowe;
þerfore couden he hym nat knowe;
he &yogh;af him charite,
&yogh; he it tok wiþ milde mod
And seyde Ihu, þat deyde en rod,
Louerd, I þanke þe !
Louerd, i herd be þou ay!
þat i haue beden þat ilke day,
þat I may for þi sake
Of hem þat in myn owene lond
Serueden me to fot &yogh; hond
here almesse forto take.
Nou þese men þat were out sent
a&yogh;en homward þei ben I went
To sire eufemian,
þei swore to him be heuene king:
Of alex herde þei no tyding,
as wyde as þei hadde gan.
"In eche a lond þan haue we be,
We ne founden no man þat couþe him se,
þat to him coude vs wisse."
"Allas, he seyde, þat he was born!
boþe haue I nou for lorn
Mi ioye &yogh; ek my blisse."
In þis tale wille we nat dwelle,
Bote of alex wile we telle,
þat riche pore man.
Alex was pouere mannes fere
ffulli seuentene &yogh;ere,
fro þat he hi gan,
Syttynde in a churche &yogh;erd
amonges oþere men an herd
In a simple wede.
An ymage in þat cherche stod
Of his moder þat deyde on rood
ffor oure alþres nede.
Atþe seuentene &yogh;eres ende
Spak &yogh; seyde wordes hende
þat ymage of tre
To þe wardeyn of þe churche,
seyde: "wardeyn, &yogh;if þou werche
Enyþing for me,
fleche þou In my sones man,
for seuentene &yogh;er it is i gan
þat he haþ hen þer oute;
I þe warne wyterly,
To duelle herinne he is worþi;
Whar of ne haue no doute.
he haþ deserued heuene bry&yogh;th,
þe holy gost is in him ly&yogh;th
&yogh;iuen him myy&yogh;tte &yogh; grace,
þat his preyer wiþ milde stephene
Is good &yogh; swete &yogh; mylde in heuene
Byfore my sones face."
þanne ansuerede þe wardeyn.
&yogh; seyde: "lauedi, I wille ful fayn,
and I wiste wilk."
"Go owt so swiþe so þou mayst go,
þou ne fyndest þer no mo,
Bryng him þat ilk !"
þe wardeyn wente him out ful &yogh;are,
he fond redy sittinde þere,
he brougthe him In ful sone;
And: "sire, &yogh;if it be þi wille,
þou art welcome vs vntille,
her Inne schaltou wone;
I was out after þe i sent
þoru our lauedies comandement,
þe in forto take.
Mechul honur schaltou haue,
&yogh; alle þing þat þou wilt craue,
ffor þat lauedies sake."
Whan þis word be gan to springe,
þat of him was a gret spekyngge
ffor his holinesse,
Sone he þoutthe forto wende,
To oþer londe forto lende,
þere men him knewe lesse.
þere ne wolde he lengere be,
Mannes honur forto fle,
ffro þat stede he wende
Anon to laodician
fforþ þe ry&yogh;tte wey anon,
als ihu crist him sende.
To anoþer lond he þout,
Godes wille to han I wrouth,
þer noman ne hadde him knowe.
Als swiþe as he was in þe se
fforto wende þer he wolde be,
þe wynd be gan to blowe.
þe wynd be gan þe schip to dryue
Til þat he be gonne to aryue,
als it was godes wille,
In rome þer he was fed &yogh; born,
þer his wonyng was be forn,
þei al him þoute ille.
Whan he saw non oþer won,
he be þoutte him sone anon,
Whare him was best to be;
To him sulf he seyde &yogh; þou&yogh;th:
Siþen Ihc me haþ hider i brou&yogh;th
In to þis cite,
I ne can no betere red of alle,
Bote gon to my faderes halle
In pore mannes rowte,
I may sitte in þe rowe,
þer nis no man þat me schal knowe:
So longe Ich haue ben oute.
Vpon a day sire Eufemian
ffro þe paleys was he gan,
and homward he &yogh;ede,
wiþ mikel folk þat wel waren dy&yogh;th,
Boþe knaue sweyn &yogh; knyth,
Lat gode were in hede.
Alex þoute: he wolde him mete,
&yogh; ran forþ faste be þe strete
vn til þat he him mette;
Whan he say þat was ney,
Wiþ a voys boþe loud &yogh; hey
Sire Eufemian he grette,
&yogh; seyde wiþ a mylde stephene:
Sire, for godes loue of heuene
haue merci on me !
Ich am a pilgrym pore &yogh; nakud,
þat gret defaute haþ I maked,
Sire, as &yogh;e may I se ;
Resceyue me into þin halle,
þere þine pore men ben alle,
&yogh; graunte me þe mete!
And I schal preye ny&yogh;th &yogh; day
for þi sone þat is awey,
þat Ihu crist him þe gete
&yogh; grante þe for his wondes fiue
þat þou myttest him se in þine lyue,
þat was þin herte blisse,
sire, to habbe wiþoute strif
Ioye of him in soule &yogh; lif,
Crist þe til him wisse.
þanne eufemian þer wiþstod
grantede him wiþ milde mod
þe pore man his bone,
he grantede him to cloþe &yogh; fede
bad his men he scholde him lede
To his hous as sone;
And grauntede him, as &yogh;ou telle,
an hous allone þer in to dwelle
Wiþouten eny fere,
&yogh; a man þat scholde him gete
and bringe him boþe drynk &yogh; mete,
Whan þat mester were.
Nou alex, as &yogh;e habbeþ i herd,
Is dweld in his fader &yogh;erd
as a pore man,
In preyere of fasting &yogh; waking
he seruede Ihu heuene kyng
In al þat he can.
Seruant&yogh; þat were proute &yogh; &yogh;ungge
him dryuen ofte to heþingge,
As he &yogh;ede vp &yogh; doun,
&yogh; ofte siþes broþ of ffissches
&yogh; water, as he wessch here dissches,
þei caste vp on his croun.
Of al þe schame þat þei him wrou&yogh;the
he þonkede Ihu, þat him bouthe
&yogh; &yogh;af him my&yogh;tte þerto ;
he was þolemod in alle þinge,
þer out ne my&yogh;tte noman him bringe,
ffor nowth þei couden do.
þere dwelde alex stille,
as it was Ihu cristes wille,
Seuentene &yogh;er;
In his owene faderes In
kneu him non of al his kyn
Neyþer fer ne ner.
At þe seuenteþe &yogh;eres ende
he wiste he scholde hennes wende
þoru grace of þe holy gast
To Ihu crist godes sone,
In blisse of heuene ay forto wone,
In þe lif þat euere schal last.
he gat him enke perchemyn,
and al his lif he wrot þer In,
þat he had lyued here,
And radde it seþen eueridel
&yogh; þonkede god, so my&yogh;the wel,
Wiþ ful bliþe chere.
Whan he hadde I do, as I &yogh;ou say,
Vpon þe holy soneday
þat com after nest
meche ioye &yogh; meche ly&yogh;th
his soule, þat was so fair &yogh; bry&yogh;th,
Wente out at his brest.
When his soule was went to heuene,
þer com a vois wiþ milde stephene
In to an holy stede,
þer al þe folk of rome were
Godes seruise forto here,
To bidden holy bede,
and seyde þes wordes wiþoute faille :
Comeþ to me þat haueþ trauaille
Oþer charge for my sake !
Comeþ to me, I schal &yogh;ou fille
Wiþ ioye blisse at al &yogh;oure wille,
þat neuere mor schal slake.
Whan þe folk hadde þat word herd,
þe were echone sore afered
&yogh; fullen doun to grounde ;
As þei leyen &yogh; hedde here face,
þar com owth þoru godes grace
In a litel stounde
Anoþer stephene mylde &yogh; meke
bad hem vp arise &yogh; seke
A godes man of rome,
þat &yogh;e mowe þoru hi&yogh; preyer
Of his godnesse ben partener
At þe day of dome."
þei risen alle wiþ bliþe chere
&yogh; southe boþe fer &yogh; nere,
Be weye &yogh; ek be strete;
Bote for noþing þat þei wrouth,
Wiþ þat relyk þat þei south
My&yogh;tte þe nowar mete ;
Til þat voit&yogh; wiþ worde meke
Com a&yogh;en &yogh; bad hem seke
In sire Eufemianes hous,
"þer &yogh;e scholle sone fynde
þat schal hele dombe &yogh; blynde,
A relik precious."
þanne wente þei forþ anan
&yogh; askeden sire eufemian :
&yogh;if he knew swich a man.
he ansuerede redely
&yogh; seyde: lordingges, sikerly,
Of swich ne wot I non.
þanne wente forþ þe emperuors,
Archadious &yogh; honorius,
&yogh; Innocent þe pape
anon to sire Eufemias In;
Til þei come þere, wolde þei nat blyn;
Wiþ hem wente forþ greth frape.
þanne cam forþ a knaue anan
&yogh; seyde to sire eufemian:
Gowe, sire, I rede,
And loken at &yogh;oure pilgrim
þat &yogh;e han fed of long tym,
Wher he be quik oþer dede.
&yogh;if he be ded þat was so meke,
he is þat man þat þei seke,
I wot wiþ oute drede:
he was a man of holy lif,
Of him com neuere stout ne strif,
Ne wikke word ne dede.
Whanne eufemian þat i herde,
he &yogh;ede to loke hou alex ferde
To his hous ful ry&yogh;th;
he fond him ded whan he com þare,
his face, þer it lay on bere,
as sonne schinede bry&yogh;th.
In his hond he fond a skript,
Eufemian &yogh;ede to him as tyd
To wyte what was þer Inne;
Bote for nones kynnes gyn
Out of þe hond þat it was In
My&yogh;tte he it nat wynne.
Whan he ne my&yogh;tte no betere spede,
To þe emperour he &yogh;ede
&yogh; tolde him þat tydingge;
þane comeþ he a&yogh;en god pas,
Til he comen þar he was
þe dede corps liggynde.
Whan þei comen Into þe hous,
þe emperour seyde þus
and on þis manere:
þei we for synne ben vnworþi,
We han to kepyng nawth for þi
Of þese londes here;
And þis man þat we pope calle
haþ þe kepyng of vs alle
&yogh; of holy churche;
þerfore deliure vs vp þe skryt,
þat we þere þoru may se &yogh; wyt
hou we schulle wiþ þe werche.
Wen þei hadde þus seid here wille,
þe pope leyde his hond þer tille,
Alex þan let go.
&yogh; þe pope as tyd let rede it þere
Byfore al þo þat þer were,
herynde his fader also.
Whan his fader herde it rede,
he was for wondred &yogh; for drede,
for sorwe he was ney ded;
as man þat hadde deþes wounde
he fel swingge doun to grounde,
heuy so any led.
Wan he hadde longe I leyn,
þan his stat bi com a gayn,
&yogh; made reuly chere ;
he rof his brest, he drou his her
wiþ duelful cry &yogh; syking sor,
þat pite it was to here.
Meche doel it is to telle
hou he on þat body felle,
Of weping blan he nouth.
"Allas nou hastou duelled here
Alle þese seuentene &yogh;ere
In myn owene In,
&yogh; þou hast boren þe so lowe
&yogh; noldest neuere ben o knowe
þat þou were of oure kyn.
Out ay allas weylawey,
þat I euere a bod þis day
þis sorwe forto se!
I wende han had of þe solas
In myn elde, allas allas,
for doel ded willi be !"
Whenne his moder herde of þis,
&yogh;e sterte forþ in haste i wis
as a leonesse,
Wiþ hire sulf sche ferde to wonder,
Sche rof hire cloþes al to sonder
In a gret wodnesse,
Sche drou hire her as sche were wod,
&yogh; seyde: "for him þat deyde on rod,
&yogh;e men, &yogh;iueþ me wey,
þat I may to my sone go !
Was neuere moder half so wo
As me is þis day.
&yogh;iueþ me roum &yogh; lat me se
þe body þat was boren of me
fed was of my brest,
Leteþ me come þe cors vntil,
ffor &yogh;e wyten þat it is skyl
þat I be it next."
Whan sche my&yogh;tte ney hit nere,
Sche fel þer on wiþ sori chere
&yogh; seyde: "allas, my son,
Whi hauest tou þus wiþ vs fare,
Suffred vs for þe sorwe &yogh; care,
Whi hastou þus don ?
þou hast i seye þi fader &yogh; me
Wepen &yogh; maken gret doel for þe
Boþe erly &yogh; late,
And tou hast seuentene &yogh;er
Vn knowe duelled wiþ vs her
In pouere beggeres state."
Ofte siþe &yogh;e fel doun
Opon þe body al I swoun,
&yogh; kissede honden &yogh; feet,
&yogh; þat face þat was so swete
Sche it kiste &yogh; made it wete
Wiþ teres þat sche let.
Sche seide: "allas, what me is wo!
þou were my sone wiþoute mo;
Wepeþ al folk wiþ me!
I haue þe fed many a day;
Allas owt &yogh; weylawey,
þat I ne knew nout þe!
þou my&yogh;test han ben a greth lording
&yogh; honured als a kyng,
&yogh;if it hadde ben þi wille;
Nou hauest þou had despit &yogh; wrong
Of þine þralles euere among,
&yogh; born it ful stille.
Allas, who schal &yogh;iue to me
Welle of teres to wepe for þe
Boþe day &yogh; ny&yogh;th?
Allas allas, what me is wo!
I wolde myn herte it breke a tuo
þat I ne saye nowth þis sy&yogh;th."
þanne cam forþ a drery þing,
I clad in cloþes of mournyng,
It was alex wif;
Sche wep þat pite was to se
&yogh; seyde: "allas, ful wo is me,
þat euere hadde I lyf!
Nou al my ioye awey is gon.
Er hadde I hope, now haue I non
To sen him on lyue;
Nou am I wydewe, allas þat stounde!
Sorwe haþ &yogh;iuen myn herte a wounde
þat me to deþe schal dryue.
Allas, what is me to rede!
Mi mirour is broken &yogh; is dede
þat my liking was Inne.
hope of ioye now haue I lorn,
&yogh; sorwe is newed me be forn
þat neuere more schal blynne."
Al þat folk þat stod be syde,
þat say þe sorwe so vn ruyde,
þey wepe ful tendreliche;
þer ne was non þat my&yogh;tte him holde,
Man ne wif man, &yogh;ung ne old;
&yogh; þat nas no ferliche.
þe pope com forþ, &yogh; te emperours
Leten him bringe owt of þe hous
&yogh; leyden him on a bere
And beren wiþ gret solempnete
In to þe mydeward of þe cyte
&yogh; cryeden þat alle my&yogh;ten here,
&yogh; seyden : comeþ, seþ þis holyman
þat &yogh;e han south euerichon!
here he is in þis place;
ffounden he is &yogh; is here
þat holy body on a bere,
þoru help of godes grace.
Alle þat wisten of þat cry
þei ronne þider hastifly
ne drou it nowt to abyd.
And alle þe sike þat þer were,
þat my&yogh;tte touche þe body þere,
þei were hol als tyd.
þe blynde of him hadden here sy&yogh;th,
þe wode here wyth hadde ful ry&yogh;th,
þe halte here lymes lele.
þer ne was non þat þider my&yogh;te wynne
What syknesse þat þei were Inne,
Lat þei ne hadde here hele.
Whan þe emperour him say þat wonder,
he tok þe bere &yogh;ide þer vnder,
Wiþ þe pope he wende,
ffor he wolde ben mad holy
þoru þe bering of þat body,
he tok þe bere in hande.
he let sowe in þe cyte
Gold &yogh; siluer gret plente,
&yogh; þat was for þis skyl,
ffor þe folk scholde hem wiþdrawe;
bote þat a vaillede nat an hawe,
þey toke no tent þer til.
þei preceden euere ner &yogh; nerre,
fforto comen to þe bere
þat þe corps lay Inne;
þei preseden þerto wiþ gret fors,
þat vnneþe wiþ þat holy cors
To churche my&yogh;te þei wynne.
Whanne þei comen to þe churche,
A toumbe of gold he leten wurche
Wiþ preciouse stones;
In seue dayes it was dy&yogh;th
fful richeliche al a ry&yogh;th,
þei leyden þer inne þe bones.
Wan þat holy cors was leyd
In to þe toumbe richeliche I greyþud
Wiþ ful meche honour:
To alle þat were in þat place
þer com owt þoru godes grace
A ful swete odour.
So swete ne smelde þei neuere non,
Als so wode as þey hadden gon,
Of no spiserye.
þei worchipeden him alle wiþ o stephne
&yogh; þankeden Ihu crist of heuene
&yogh; his moder Marye.
Nou Ihu crist þoru þe preyer
Of þat cors seint I tolde &yogh;ou her,
&yogh;if þi wille it be,
Graunte vs alle god endyng
And in heuene a wonying!
Amen par charite.
